title: Drawing, "Two Designs for Brooches in the "Byzantine" Style", 1860–65
medium:
Pen and brown ink, watercolor, graphite, ruled borders in graphite
Support: white wove paper
markings: Stamps: Upper margin, center, a blind stamp: C. Ansorge/Giojelliere orefice/Roma/ Piazza de Spagnia 72 Verso: Museum for the Arts of Decoration
inscribed: In graphite, center above embossed stamp: Ansorge/Giojelliere Orefice/Roma/Piazza di Spagnia 72
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli, Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward Brandegee, Boston
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Top drawing in image.At left: In the center is a freamed circle with a white cross, it's top red.  Framed is lozenge shape.  In the corners are small circles, with white stars upon blue, connected with a kind of knot.  At right:  a central cross is similarly framed.
